1→//! Consumer module - Submit and manage compute jobs
     2→//!
     3→//! This module provides the consumer side of the compute marketplace,
     4→//! allowing users to submit inference jobs to providers and receive results.
     5→
     6→use crate::compute::events::{ComputeJobRequest, ComputeJobResult, ComputeJobFeedback};
     7→use nostr::{JobStatus, Nip90Error};
     8→use serde::{Deserialize, Serialize};
     9→use std::collections::HashMap;
    10→use std::sync::{Arc, Mutex};
    11→use std::time::{SystemTime, UNIX_EPOCH};
    12→use tokio::sync::mpsc;
    13→
    14→/// Job status for tracking job lifecycle
    15→#[derive(Debug, Clone, Copy, PartialEq, Eq, Serialize, Deserialize)]
    16→pub enum JobState {
    17→    /// Job has been submitted to relays
    18→    Pending,
    19→    /// Provider requested payment
    20→    PaymentRequired,
    21→    /// Provider is processing the job
    22→    Processing,
    23→    /// Job completed successfully
    24→    Completed,
    25→    /// Job failed with error
    26→    Failed,
    27→    /// Job was cancelled by user
    28→    Cancelled,
    29→}
    30→
    31→impl From<JobStatus> for JobState {
    32→    fn from(status: JobStatus) -> Self {
    33→        match status {
    34→            JobStatus::PaymentRequired => JobState::PaymentRequired,
    35→            JobStatus::Processing => JobState::Processing,
    36→            JobStatus::Success => JobState::Completed,
    37→            JobStatus::Error => JobState::Failed,
    38→            JobStatus::Partial => JobState::Processing, // Partial is still in progress
    39→        }
    40→    }
    41→}
    42→
    43→/// Job tracking information
    44→#[derive(Debug, Clone, Serialize, Deserialize)]
    45→pub struct JobInfo {
    46→    /// Unique job ID (event ID of the request)
    47→    pub job_id: String,
    48→    /// Current job state
    49→    pub state: JobState,
    50→    /// The original request
    51→    pub request: String, // Serialized ComputeJobRequest
    52→    /// Job result content (when completed)
    53→    pub result: Option<String>,
    54→    /// Error message (when failed)
    55→    pub error: Option<String>,
    56→    /// Provider pubkey (if accepted by a provider)
    57→    pub provider: Option<String>,
    58→    /// Payment amount in millisats (if required)
    59→    pub payment_amount: Option<u64>,
    60→    /// Payment bolt11 invoice (if required)
    61→    pub payment_bolt11: Option<String>,
    62→    /// Timestamp when job was submitted
    63→    pub submitted_at: u64,
    64→    /// Timestamp when job completed/failed
    65→    pub completed_at: Option<u64>,
    66→}
    67→
    68→impl JobInfo {
    69→    /// Create a new pending job
    70→    #[allow(dead_code)]
    71→    pub fn new(job_id: impl Into<String>, request: impl Into<String>) -> Self {
    72→        let now = SystemTime::now()
    73→            .duration_since(UNIX_EPOCH)
    74→            .unwrap()
    75→            .as_secs();
    76→
    77→        Self {
    78→            job_id: job_id.into(),
    79→            state: JobState::Pending,
    80→            request: request.into(),
    81→            result: None,
    82→            error: None,
    83→            provider: None,
    84→            payment_amount: None,
    85→            payment_bolt11: None,
    86→            submitted_at: now,
    87→            completed_at: None,
    88→        }
    89→    }
    90→
    91→    /// Update job state from feedback
    92→    pub fn update_from_feedback(&mut self, feedback: &ComputeJobFeedback, provider: impl Into<String>) {
    93→        let inner = feedback.inner();
    94→        self.state = JobState::from(inner.status.clone());
    95→        self.provider = Some(provider.into());
    96→
    97→        if let Some(amount) = inner.amount {
    98→            self.payment_amount = Some(amount);
    99→        }

1→//! Spark wallet wrapper for the Breez SDK
     2→//!
     3→//! This module provides a high-level wallet interface for Bitcoin/Lightning payments
     4→//! through the Breez Spark SDK. It wraps the underlying SDK to provide a simpler API
     5→//! for OpenAgents applications.
     6→//!
     7→//! # Architecture
     8→//!
     9→//! ```text
    10→//! SparkWallet
    11→//!   ├─ SparkSigner (our BIP44 key derivation)
    12→//!   ├─ Breez SDK Client (network ops)
    13→//!   └─ Local persistence (wallet state)
    14→//! ```
    15→
    16→use crate::{SparkSigner, SparkError};
    17→use breez_sdk_spark::{
    18→    BreezSdk, ConnectRequest, Network as SdkNetwork, PrepareSendPaymentRequest,
    19→    PrepareSendPaymentResponse, ReceivePaymentMethod, ReceivePaymentRequest,
    20→    ReceivePaymentResponse, SendPaymentRequest, SendPaymentResponse, Seed,
    21→};
    22→use serde::{Deserialize, Serialize};
    23→use std::sync::Arc;
    24→
    25→/// Bitcoin network to use for Spark wallet
    26→#[derive(Debug, Clone, Copy, PartialEq, Eq, Serialize, Deserialize, Default)]
    27→pub enum Network {
    28→    /// Bitcoin mainnet
    29→    Mainnet,
    30→    /// Bitcoin testnet
    31→    #[default]
    32→    Testnet,
    33→    /// Bitcoin signet (staging)
    34→    Signet,
    35→    /// Bitcoin regtest (local development)
    36→    Regtest,
    37→}
    38→
    39→impl From<Network> for SdkNetwork {
    40→    fn from(network: Network) -> Self {
    41→        match network {
    42→            Network::Mainnet => SdkNetwork::Mainnet,
    43→            Network::Testnet | Network::Signet | Network::Regtest => SdkNetwork::Regtest,
    44→        }
    45→    }
    46→}
    47→
    48→/// Wallet balance information
    49→#[derive(Debug, Clone, Default, Serialize, Deserialize)]
    50→pub struct Balance {
    51→    /// Spark layer 2 balance in satoshis
    52→    pub spark_sats: u64,
    53→    /// Lightning balance in satoshis
    54→    pub lightning_sats: u64,
    55→    /// On-chain balance in satoshis (funds in cooperative exit)
    56→    pub onchain_sats: u64,
    57→}
    58→
    59→impl Balance {
    60→    /// Get total balance across all layers
    61→    pub fn total_sats(&self) -> u64 {
    62→        self.spark_sats.saturating_add(self.lightning_sats).saturating_add(self.onchain_sats)
    63→    }
    64→
    65→    /// Check if wallet has any funds
    66→    pub fn is_empty(&self) -> bool {
    67→        self.total_sats() == 0
    68→    }
    69→}
    70→
    71→/// Wallet information and status
    72→#[derive(Debug, Clone, Serialize, Deserialize)]
    73→pub struct WalletInfo {
    74→    /// Public key of the wallet (for receiving)
    75→    pub public_key: String,
    76→    /// Network the wallet is operating on
    77→    pub network: Network,
    78→    /// Whether wallet is synced with operators
    79→    pub synced: bool,
    80→    /// Number of pending operations
    81→    pub pending_ops: u32,
    82→}
    83→
    84→/// Configuration for initializing a Spark wallet
    85→#[derive(Debug, Clone)]
    86→pub struct WalletConfig {
    87→    /// Network to operate on
    88→    pub network: Network,
    89→    /// Optional Breez API key (required for production)
    90→    pub api_key: Option<String>,
    91→    /// Storage directory for wallet data
    92→    pub storage_dir: std::path::PathBuf,
    93→}
    94→
    95→impl Default for WalletConfig {
    96→    fn default() -> Self {
    97→        Self {
    98→            network: Network::Testnet,
    99→            api_key: None,
   100→            storage_dir: dirs::data_local_dir()
   101→                .unwrap_or_else(|| std::path::PathBuf::from("."))
   102→                .join("openagents")
   103→                .join("spark"),
   104→        }
   105→    }
   106→}
   107→
   108→/// Spark wallet for Bitcoin/Lightning payments
   109→///
   110→/// This wraps the Breez SDK to provide self-custodial Bitcoin payments
   111→/// via Lightning, Spark Layer 2, and on-chain.
   112→pub struct SparkWallet {
   113→    signer: SparkSigner,
   114→    config: WalletConfig,
   115→    sdk: Arc<BreezSdk>,
   116→}
   117→
   118→impl SparkWallet {
   119→    /// Create a new Spark wallet with the given signer and configuration
   120→    ///
   121→    /// This method initializes the Breez SDK with the wallet's mnemonic and configuration,
   122→    /// connecting to the Spark network and starting background synchronization.
   123→    ///
   124→    /// # Arguments
   125→    /// * `signer` - The SparkSigner for signing transactions
   126→    /// * `config` - Wallet configuration (network, API key, storage)
   127→    ///
   128→    /// # Example
   129→    /// ```rust,ignore
   130→    /// use spark::{SparkSigner, SparkWallet, WalletConfig, Network};
   131→    ///
   132→    /// let signer = SparkSigner::from_mnemonic("your mnemonic here", "")?;
   133→    /// let config = WalletConfig {
   134→    ///     network: Network::Testnet,
   135→    ///     ..Default::default()
   136→    /// };
   137→    /// let wallet = SparkWallet::new(signer, config).await?;
   138→    /// ```
   139→    pub async fn new(signer: SparkSigner, config: WalletConfig) -> Result<Self, SparkError> {
   140→        // Create storage directory if it doesn't exist
   141→        std::fs::create_dir_all(&config.storage_dir)
   142→            .map_err(|e| SparkError::InitializationFailed(format!("Failed to create storage directory: {}", e)))?;
   143→
   144→        // Convert our network enum to SDK network
   145→        let sdk_network: SdkNetwork = config.network.into();
   146→
   147→        // Create SDK config with default settings for the network
   148→        let mut sdk_config = breez_sdk_spark::default_config(sdk_network);
   149→

1→//! NIP-34 event builders for AgentGit
     2→//!
     3→//! Provides builder pattern for creating Nostr events related to git collaboration.
     4→//! All builders return [`EventTemplate`] which must be signed before publishing.
     5→//!
     6→//! ## Standard NIP-34 Builders
     7→//!
     8→//! - [`PullRequestBuilder`] - kind:1618, create pull requests with commits
     9→//! - [`PatchBuilder`] - kind:1617, create patches from git diffs
    10→//! - [`StatusEventBuilder`] - kinds:1630-1633, set PR/patch status
    11→//!
    12→//! ## AgentGit Extensions
    13→//!
    14→//! These extend NIP-34 with agent-native workflows:
    15→//!
    16→//! - [`IssueClaimBuilder`] - kind:1634, agent claims issue for work
    17→//! - [`BountyOfferBuilder`] - kind:1636, attach Lightning bounty to issue
    18→//! - [`WorkAssignmentBuilder`] - kind:1635, maintainer assigns work to agent
    19→//! - [`BountyClaimBuilder`] - kind:1637, claim bounty payment on PR merge
    20→//!
    21→//! ## Usage
    22→//!
    23→//! All builders follow the same pattern:
    24→//!
    25→//! ```rust
    26→//! use agentgit::nostr::events::PullRequestBuilder;
    27→//!
    28→//! // Build event template
    29→//! let template = PullRequestBuilder::new(
    30→//!     "30617:pubkey:repo-id",       // Repository address
    31→//!     "Fix authentication bug",     // Subject/title
    32→//!     "This PR fixes the bug by...", // Description
    33→//! )
    34→//! .commit("abc123def456")            // Required: commit ID
    35→//! .clone_url("https://github.com/user/repo.git") // Required: clone URL
    36→//! .trajectory("session_xyz")         // Optional: trajectory session ID
    37→//! .build();
    38→//!
    39→//! // Sign with identity (requires wallet integration)
    40→//! // let event = identity.sign_event(template)?;
    41→//! // client.publish_event(event).await?;
    42→//! ```
    43→//!
    44→//! ## Stacked Diffs
    45→//!
    46→//! Pull requests support stacked diffs for breaking large changes into reviewable layers:
    47→//!
    48→//! ```rust
    49→//! use agentgit::nostr::events::PullRequestBuilder;
    50→//!
    51→//! // Layer 1: Foundation
    52→//! let layer1 = PullRequestBuilder::new(
    53→//!     "30617:pubkey:repo-id",
    54→//!     "Layer 1: Add FooService interface",
    55→//!     "Defines the interface for FooService",
    56→//! )
    57→//! .commit("abc123")
    58→//! .clone_url("https://github.com/user/repo.git")
    59→//! .stack("stack_uuid_123")  // Groups all layers
    60→//! .layer(1, 4)              // Layer 1 of 4
    61→//! .build();
    62→//!
    63→//! // Layer 2: Build on Layer 1
    64→//! let layer2 = PullRequestBuilder::new(
    65→//!     "30617:pubkey:repo-id",
    66→//!     "Layer 2: Implement FooService",
    67→//!     "Concrete implementation of FooService",
    68→//! )
    69→//! .commit("def456")
    70→//! .clone_url("https://github.com/user/repo.git")
    71→//! .depends_on("layer1_event_id")  // Must merge after Layer 1
    72→//! .stack("stack_uuid_123")
    73→//! .layer(2, 4)
    74→//! .build();
    75→//! ```
    76→//!
    77→//! Tags used for stacked diffs:
    78→//! - `depends_on`: Event ID of dependency PR (must be merged first)
    79→//! - `stack`: UUID grouping related PRs
    80→//! - `layer`: Position in stack (e.g., "2 of 4")
    81→//!
    82→//! ## Trajectory Integration
    83→//!
    84→//! PRs can link to agent trajectory sessions for transparent work verification:
    85→//!
    86→//! ```rust,ignore
    87→//! use agentgit::nostr::events::PullRequestBuilder;
    88→//!
    89→//! let pr = PullRequestBuilder::new(...)
    90→//!     .trajectory("session_id")          // NIP-SA trajectory session
    91→//!     .trajectory_hash("sha256_hash")    // Hash for verification
    92→//!     .build();
    93→//! ```
    94→//!
    95→//! ## Event Publishing
    96→//!
    97→//! Event templates must be signed before publishing:
    98→//!
    99→//! ```rust,ignore
   100→//! // 1. Build template
   101→//! let template = PullRequestBuilder::new(...).build();
   102→//!
   103→//! // 2. Sign with identity (requires wallet::UnifiedIdentity)
   104→//! let event = identity.sign_event(template)?;
   105→//!
   106→//! // 3. Publish to relays (not yet implemented in AgentGit)
   107→//! client.publish_event(event).await?;
   108→//!
   109→//! // 4. Cache locally for immediate display
   110→//! client.cache_event(event).await?;
   111→//! ```
   112→//!
   113→//! ## Testing
   114→//!
   115→//! All builders have comprehensive unit tests:
   116→//!
   117→//! ```bash
   118→//! cargo test -p agentgit events
   119→//! ```
   120→
   121→use nostr::EventTemplate;
   122→use std::time::{SystemTime, UNIX_EPOCH};
   123→
   124→/// Builder for creating issue claim events (kind:1634)
   125→///
   126→/// An issue claim event allows an agent to claim an issue for work.
   127→#[allow(dead_code)]
   128→pub struct IssueClaimBuilder {
   129→    issue_event_id: String,
   130→    repo_address: String,
   131→    issue_author_pubkey: String,
   132→    content: Option<String>,
   133→    trajectory_session_id: Option<String>,
   134→    estimate_seconds: Option<u64>,
   135→}
   136→
   137→#[allow(dead_code)]
   138→impl IssueClaimBuilder {
   139→    /// Create a new issue claim builder
   140→    ///
   141→    /// # Arguments
   142→    /// * `issue_event_id` - The event ID of the issue being claimed
   143→    /// * `repo_address` - The repository address tag (e.g., "30617:\<pubkey\>:\<repo-id\>")
   144→    /// * `issue_author_pubkey` - The pubkey of the issue author
   145→    ///
   146→    /// # Examples
   147→    ///
   148→    /// ```
   149→    /// use agentgit::nostr::events::IssueClaimBuilder;
   150→    ///

content.content:
1→//! FROSTR - Native Rust implementation of FROST threshold signatures for Nostr
     2→//!
     3→//! FROSTR (FROST for Nostr) enables k-of-n threshold Schnorr signatures where:
     4→//! - The private key is never reconstructed
     5→//! - Signatures are indistinguishable from single-key signatures
     6→//! - Compromised shares can be replaced without changing identity
     7→//! - Coordination happens via encrypted Nostr events
     8→//!
     9→//! This crate provides the cryptographic foundation for NIP-SA Sovereign Agents,
    10→//! enabling agent identities protected by threshold signatures where operators
    11→//! cannot extract the full private key.
    12→//!
    13→//! ## Modules
    14→//!
    15→//! - [`keygen`] - Key generation and Shamir Secret Sharing
    16→//! - [`signing`] - FROST signing protocol
    17→//! - [`ecdh`] - Threshold ECDH for encryption
    18→//! - [`credential`] - Bech32 encoding for group and share credentials
    19→//! - [`bifrost`] - Bifrost protocol for peer coordination via Nostr
    20→//!
    21→//! ## Example
    22→//!
    23→//! ```
    24→//! use frostr::keygen::generate_key_shares;
    25→//!
    26→//! // Generate 2-of-3 threshold key shares
    27→//! let shares = generate_key_shares(2, 3).unwrap();
    28→//! assert_eq!(shares.len(), 3);
    29→//!
    30→//! // Any 2 shares can sign, but no single share can
    31→//! // Signing happens via the Bifrost protocol
    32→//! ```
    33→
    34→pub mod bifrost;
    35→pub mod credential;
    36→pub mod ecdh;
    37→pub mod keygen;
    38→pub mod signing;
    39→
    40→// Re-export commonly used types
    41→pub use credential::{GroupCredential, ShareCredential};
    42→pub use keygen::{generate_key_shares, FrostShare, Share};
    43→
    44→/// FROSTR protocol version
    45→pub const VERSION: &str = "0.1.0";
    46→
    47→/// Error types for FROSTR operations
    48→#[derive(Debug, thiserror::Error)]
    49→pub enum Error {
    50→    #[error("Invalid threshold: k={0} must be <= n={1}")]
    51→    InvalidThreshold(u32, u32),
    52→
    53→    #[error("Invalid share count: need {need} shares, got {got}")]
    54→    InvalidShareCount { need: u32, got: u32 },
    55→
    56→    #[error("Cryptographic error: {0}")]
    57→    Crypto(String),
    58→
    59→    #[error("FROST error: {0}")]
    60→    FrostError(String),
    61→
    62→    #[error("Encoding error: {0}")]
    63→    Encoding(String),
    64→
    65→    #[error("Protocol error: {0}")]
    66→    Protocol(String),
    67→
    68→    #[error("Transport error: {0}")]
    69→    Transport(String),
    70→
    71→    #[error("Signing error: {0}")]
    72→    Signing(String),
    73→
    74→    #[error("Timeout waiting for threshold peers")]
    75→    Timeout,
    76→
    77→    #[error("ECDH error: {0}")]
    78→    EcdhError(String),
    79→
    80→    #[error("Invalid public key: {0}")]
    81→    InvalidPublicKey(String),
    82→
    83→    #[error("Invalid secret key: {0}")]
    84→    InvalidSecretKey(String),
    85→
    86→    #[error(transparent)]
    87→    Other(#[from] anyhow::Error),
    88→}
    89→
    90→pub type Result<T> = std::result::Result<T, Error>;
